a.n: Take Away Blue, a Blue Note Tribute

p.k: Take Away Blue, a Blue Note Tribute 2014. Patrick Watson. Worldwide
p.d: Can jazz play a role in pop and indie music? How do jazz standards inspire today's musicians? This short film is a tribute to Blue Note Records, which celebrated its 75th anniversary in 2014. Colin Solal Cardo visited New York, Montreal, Lisbon, and a small village in Ard√©che, France to find the answers from four seasoned artists. Singer-songwriter Patrick Watson covers "Summertime" with a string quartet, composer Moses Sumney improvises a cappella on "Moanin''' in the streets of New York City, multi-instrumentalist Alex Zhang Hungtai jams on "Blue Train" in a Lisbon cellar, and electronic music producer Mondkopf weaves a propelling piece from "Turning Point" at a campground. Each segment opens with the artists reflecting on a specific musical memory before performing an acoustic set.
